question: What is the main challenge in using satellite SIF observations for crop yield prediction, and how does the proposed CSR-U-Net approach address this challenge?
answer: The main challenge is that satellite SIF observations are only available at a coarse spatial resolution (e.g. 3-5km), making it difficult to determine how individual crop types or farms are doing. CSR-U-Net, a novel approach, addresses this challenge by training a U-Net to predict SIF at a very fine spatial resolution (30 meters) using fine-resolution input features, despite only having access to coarse-resolution SIF labels at training time.
